I think you are right. It could be because the crawling overwhelms of DNS s=
ervice. Because I see that these urls are re-crawled later and the response=
s seem OK.  Thanks for your answer, Gordon. 

-Jian

--- In archive-crawler=
@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> On 4/18/13 12:19 PM, =
Jian wrote:
> > I am using Heritrix 1.14.4 starting with 5000 seeds.
> > Mo=
st options are just default. But I got quite a few error messages in the se=
ed report, saying that "domain unresolvable". Examples are below:

ttp://facproductions.net/preprints/

tp://jameshamilton.eu/sites/default/files/MPhilTransferReport.pdf

hese are regular URLs and you can easily access the page content from a reg=
ular web browser. But why Heritrix reports this error? Is there any configu=
ration that I did wrong?

ling limits) of DNS 
> services... that's what I'd look at first.

e could be more hints in the crawl.log or ARC/WARC records -

ailures happen in batches then resolve? Do the records
